alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Orange and northeastern Windsor Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Randolph, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Strafford, Pomfret, Tunbridge, Sharon, Royalton, Randolph, Bethel, Thetford, Barnard, Norwich, South Tunbridge, South Strafford, East Bethel, South Randolph, South Royalton, North Royalton, North Pomfret and East Barnard. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 9 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
